snippet.textDisplay:
I did (as in listen to this music), just thought I'd add in another npc quote for the fun of it. My misplaced faith in Internet humanity lead me to believe I could start some sort of comment chain on this theme (like someone else who wrote down Ogden's main line).
Yet, no offence taken, so lets just forget all this and go back to enjoying SupraDarky's music.

snippet.textDisplay: the first time i played this game, i didnt know english, and when i talk to the drunk guy in the map, i tought that he was like sad or suffering for something, just for his voice, then when i learn english, i talk to him again and i realize that he was drunk and nobody believes what he said. I laugh a lot about that cuz for me the story was different xD...

snippet.textDisplay:
You know what would be a treat?  If we saw Adria return in Diablo 3.  We never saw what happened to her in Diablo 2 (That part of the village from D1 was cut off from what you can explore in D2) so I'd like to think she used all her Scrolls of the Apocalypse and got the heck out of there :).

......"I sense a soul in search of Adria!"
snippet.textOriginal:
You know what would be a treat?  If we saw Adria return in Diablo 3.  We never saw what happened to her in Diablo 2 (That part of the village from D1 was cut off from what you can explore in D2) so I'd like to think she used all her Scrolls of the Apocalypse and got the heck out of there :).

......"I sense a soul in search of Adria!"

snippet.textDisplay:
So damn good.
Knowing that the composer for Diablo III will be a different person won't be enough for me not to buy the game, but it will make me hope I can somehow import the songs from I and II, so I can 'relive' my past experiences.
snippet.textOriginal:
So damn good.
Knowing that the composer for Diablo III will be a different person won't be enough for me not to buy the game, but it will make me hope I can somehow import the songs from I and II, so I can 'relive' my past experiences.

ah, I hate that kind of attitude. Siskel and Ebert never produced any #1 movies, but people respect their opinion on movies.

ah, I hate that kind of attitude. Siskel and Ebert never produced any #1 movies, but people respect their opinion on movies.

snippet.textOriginal:
disproves?

snippet.textDisplay:
The Pandamonium event disproves everything you describe.
The Prime Evils- Belial and Azmodan have hell Polarized...all they have to do is set their sights on the mortal realm and the SIN WAR will begin anew.
Diablo and Baal and Mephisto CAN return but only in the time of a millennium. So the world may be left to fend for itself against the legions of hell whilst the power of Heaven is sealed by the destruction of the Worldstone.
snippet.textOriginal:
The Pandamonium event disproves everything you describe.
The Prime Evils- Belial and Azmodan have hell Polarized...all they have to do is set their sights on the mortal realm and the SIN WAR will begin anew.

snippet.textDisplay:
there's also the question of the story.
StarCraft had a story to continue.
Warcraft kind of had a story to continue.
But what would they do about Diablo? 
He's dead and gone, all the soul stones smashed and everything.
They'd have to make it some sort of alternate reality thing, which would be stupid.
or some diablo reborn thing which would turn it into a never ending series, which would be stupid
or they'd have to invent some new prime evils, then it wouldn't be Diablo anyone
snippet.textOriginal:
there's also the question of the story.
StarCraft had a story to continue.
Warcraft kind of had a story to continue.
But what would they do about Diablo? 
He's dead and gone, all the soul stones smashed and everything.
They'd have to make it some sort of alternate reality thing, which would be stupid.
or some diablo reborn thing which would turn it into a never ending series, which would be stupid
or they'd have to invent some new prime evils, then it wouldn't be Diablo anyone

snippet.textDisplay: Man Diablo I was the first PC I ever played on my own PC back in the day. The music quality and atmosphere of Tristram just really got me. Really hope they keep the Diablo I and II style of music for III whenever that arrives. The sound design in the series as a whole was nuts.
snippet.textOriginal: Man Diablo I was the first PC I ever played on my own PC back in the day. The music quality and atmosphere of Tristram just really got me. Really hope they keep the Diablo I and II style of music for III whenever that arrives. The sound design in the series as a whole was nuts.

snippet.textDisplay: This is such a great piece of music. It goes through so many interesting twists and turns and sounds creepy haunting but also beautiful.
snippet.textOriginal: This is such a great piece of music. It goes through so many interesting twists and turns and sounds creepy haunting but also beautiful.

snippet.textDisplay: Diablo is love!!
snippet.textOriginal: Diablo is love!!

snippet.textDisplay:
Make some very unique classes.
I think there is a big difference, ability wise, between WoW and Diablo.

Well, Blizzard has called in for developers for a secret project, the exact same way they did before StarCraft 2, so you are allowed to pray, right?
snippet.textOriginal:
Make some very unique classes.

snippet.textDisplay: yeah, but how could they make it so that it so that it wouldn't just be WoW with different characters?

snippet.textDisplay:
Ahh... Diablo II.
My favorite game ever after Tekken 2.
Make a freakin' Diablo III already.
snippet.textOriginal:
Ahh... Diablo II.

snippet.textDisplay: I came from the future to tell you that Diablo 3, while a fun game, is hardly Diablo.

snippet.textDisplay: I'll just keep going for now while I figure out how to activate the High Quality option. Until then, I'm adding the "&fmt=18" part in the description of my videos if you want stereo sound!
